body_html: Yes, dropout is only applied between layers. By "at every step" I meant "for each minibatch". For each minibatch the states will be re-initialized (from a different seed, as @adamlerer points out). That can potentially lead to correlated dropout sequences for the different minibatches: Sequences generated with different seeds usually do not have statistically correlated values, but some choices of seeds may give statistically correlated sequences.

body: Yes, dropout is only applied between layers. By "at every step" I meant "for each minibatch". For each minibatch the states will be re-initialized (from a different seed, as @adamlerer points out). That can potentially lead to correlated dropout sequences for the different minibatches: [Sequences generated with different seeds usually do not have statistically correlated values, but some choices of seeds may give statistically correlated sequences.](http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/curand/device-api-overview.html#pseudorandom-sequences)
